level_1: These newsletters define what career roadmapping means for software engineers.
They explain how to match your strengths and interests to the right engineering role.
level_2: Readers learn to list out short-term (intern, junior) vs long-term (senior, staff) roles.
They provide easy steps to map skill gaps needed for each stage.
level_3: Mid-level guidance shows how to build a multi-year roadmap with yearly milestones.
They offer tips on pivoting roles—like going from frontend to backend or data engineering.
level_4: Senior-level articles explain aligning your roadmap with company goals and emerging tech areas.
They highlight mentoring juniors as part of your leadership journey.

level_1: A student picks an internship in mobile Dev based on interest.

level_2: Junior devs set goals like building two side projects in one year.
They list courses to take and certifications required annually.
level_3: Mid-level devs draft role-matching plans for advancing to senior engineer.
They include mentorship, open-source, and certification milestones.
level_4: Leads create team-wide career frameworks aligning to company strategy.
They set up mentorship programs tied to those roadmaps.
